title: Dessert culture show
review: Nice place to visit. Great work by artists preserving Rajasthan culture and diminishing string puppet art.

title: Amazing experience
review: The puppet show was beautiful. Within an hour you get to see 5-6 brilliant performances. The background story/insight was beautifully narrated and rendered, transporting us back in time. It was a wonderful wonderful experience and should not be missed by anyone travelling to Jaisalmer. Ticket was only RS. 100

title: Excellent entertaining string puppet show
review: We enjoyed an excellent entertaining string puppet show at this amazing place near Ghadisar lake in Jaisalmer. Performed by local artists, this show combines the traditional skills of string puppetry with folk music, songs and old musical instruments of Marwad and Rajasthan.

title: Do visit
review: It is all an effort of an octogenarian who we met at the entrance.. His collections done carefully over the years. Brief history of the place n displayed items. The puppet show by the talented puppeteers was nice. U can also buy puppets n other collectibles from the shop

title: Fantastic Museum & Puppet Show - A Must Visit
review: This is a Museum and puppet show with a lot of heart built into it. Mr. N.K. Sharma has done a magnificent job on his own in creating this museum for all of us to visit and enjoy in Jaisalmer.

title: Good for children
review: It's a good experience for young children otherwise ok. Although, this support the people and culture so worth considering that.

title: Mr Sharma you rock
review: Mr Sharma is a real gem, built the museum with his retirement money and hard work. There is lots of information here and some beautiful old musical instruments. There is a puppet show in the evening. Keeping an ancient culture alive. Do visit.

title: Family visit
review: This place is close to gadi sagar lake hence one can spend few minutes here. Otherwise it is not interesting place

title: Small but nice place to see
review: Visit this after 6 PM only,

title: Not worth visiting
review: This museum merged with the Folklore Museum at some point. I was attempting to go to the Folklore and it directed me here (also on my list). There's no delicate way to put this, but this is a boring museum. The collection is not too impressive and it is just a couple halls. I was hoping for a more personalized experience since reviewers at both museums talked about the people that worked at them being particularly interesting, but no such person existed on our visit. There was some guy, but he seemed a little slow (forgive me). He was more interested in selling souvenirs and getting pictures with Americans than he was talking about the collection. I did not circle back for the puppet show, so maybe that's cool, but the museum is not.

title: Not to be missed! Fascinating.
review: The museum has been founded by Mr Sharma, an inspirational man. He's a retired teacher and runs this museum from donations with no government support, to keep the traditional Rajasthani art alive and to educate students from all over India as well as tourists.

title: Information holds all the essence
review: College tour at this place, it is very informative, regarding the culture of Rajasthan and what holds the essence is museum objects which are sacred and the owner, not only looks after the museum but also finds interest in sharing the stories. Believe me, i recommend not to believe any other person than him regarding true stories of objects and everything he has got knowledge about. Fabulous location because there is a lake view near this museum. Do visit the puppet show.

title: Puppet Show
review: This is the excellent place to visit to see puppet show. Mr. Sharma has developed this place single handily. The puupet show was excellent. The timing are 6 to 7.30. worth spending time.

title: Not very interesting
review: The owner wanted to tell us a lot but the collection was not so interesting. Also the puppet show was boring and not from a good quality. The wanted to sell a lot of souvenirs amd books. For us not a very good visit.

title: A Small Museum
review: The Desert Culture Centre & Museum in Jaisalmer is actually a small museum managed by a private individual. One can visit here for a puppet show which is very good and conducted in the evenings at 6:30 PM everyday.

title: Wonderful
review: Rajasthan's main and main element and attraction. If one is in Rajasthan we all recommend to visit here, great and great information.

title: Watch the Puppet show!
review: Honestly, I didn’t expect much from the show.

title: Bringing the Kids Close to Roots!!!
review: I went there with my Family. The main aim was to made my one plus old kido see the royal culture of the puppets, an art which we have experienced as a child, but now is lost somewhere. Thankfully we were able to achieve that by seeing happiness and excitement on her face. Thanks Mr. N.K Sharma for making all the possible efforts for revival of this Art

title: Must visit!! You'll love it.
review: Watched the second show of the evening. The show was great. But above all, the artists were just amazingly talented!! There was a young kid who was playing Khartal, for me, watching that boy playing Khartal was much more fascinating than the puppet show itself. All the artists were performing so smooth and effortlessly. Please do visit the place at least once.

title: Good cultural collection
review: Good collection of heritage - but ticket is a bit expensive. Museum is not very useful as there is no one to walk thru the associated stories. Just the puppet show - which ids can enjoy.

title: Well worth a visit
review: A small museum packed with information about Rajisthani history and local culture. But the star attraction is really the owner himself, Mr Sharma. He has dedicated his life to preserving local tradition, and is clearly thrilled to pass on the knowledge to visitors. He (and the other staff) are happy to chat and answer questions but don't hassle it pressure in any way. It will probably only take 20 minutes of your time and it is well worth the 50 rupee entry fee to support a local institution

title: A teachers hard work and an inspiration to all of us
review: No words can explain how this man Mr. N.K. sharma is managing the whole show....its incredible to see how he and his team is keeping the puppet show alive....only a teacher can make this happen and turn it into such a beautiful experience despite no support from anyone around...and is so satisfied still....lucky to have met him and get our pic clicked with him

title: A one man effort to preserve a dying art
review: It is a small museum focused on the art of puppetry. There are two shows, one at 6.30 and one at 7.30 pm. There is a 10 minute TV documentary followed by a 30 minutes puppet show. The puppet show is interesting and small kids will enjoy it. But it is not as good as the one in Udaipur puppet museum. The artist who is running the museum and the show seems very committed to the cause of preserving this ancient craft but the government needs to give more support. The museum is not maintained properly

title: Excellent museum
review: We were showed around this museum by the man who started the museum many years ago.  Excellent tour with a very knowledgable guide and you will find some very intersting exhbits.  We were told you can even watch a puppet show put on by the master but unfortunately we did not have the time to see this.

title: Dessert safari by jeep & camel excellent
review: I would recommend jeep safari as it gives all the thrill & real piece of adventure over the Thar dessert.

title: Good place
review: Good place to visit specially when you are with kids. A wide collection of war equipment maintained by Indian army ..

title: An absolute must in Jaisalmer
review: The city of Jaisalmer is beautiful to look at, but the culture and history did not come alive for me until I visited the museum. Mr Sharma, a local teacher and author, founded the museum by himself. For such a small entry fee, it is well worth the ten minute tuk tuk trip from the fort to hear the Rajhastani history and culture as told by Mr Sharma and his son. Their passion is palpable and inspiring.

title: Indian desert culture truly embraced
review: I found this little museum while wandering towards the beach and I was pleasantly surprised. The chap who has created this master piece should be very proud of his achievement. Kudos to you Sir.

title: Rich Heritage
review: Ran by a wonderful Jaisalmeri musician!   Not to be missed.

title: Highlight of my tour to Jaisalmer
review: I really enjoyed the puppet show at the centre. It was entertaining and also informative at the same time. Both Children and adults will like it. The museum has shop also from where one can buy puppets, CDs, fridge magnets and other souvenirs. The visit to this place infact turn out for me the highlight of my tour to Jodhpur & Jaisalmer of all the sightseeing places I visited, of course the Tanot mata and Longewala visit were also equally good and worth visiting. I felt visit to sand dunes and desert camps are over-hyped which I didnt enjoyed that much as compared to these three spots - Desert Museum, Tanot mata and Longewala

title: Wonderful puppet show
review: A nice place where u get to know about the culture and history of Jaisalmer. Puppet show was good. Artists were very energetic. They caught my attention more than the puppet show :-D

title: Lovely and educating
review: This museum is made with love! Really interesting music instruments and explains a lot of the culture of Rajasthan. The puppet show is a must see and so skillful.

title: Must visiting place
review: A great place where u get to know about culture of jaisalmer. Puppet show is very good n entertaining..... Its not taking too much time. Kids n adults both enjoy the show.artists are very friendly n hardworking. Museum has one shop also from where u can buy CDs, fridge magnets, traditional calender, books n other useful things which are very reasonable.

title: Very informative museum
review: It is a small museum with very good information about the culture and history of Rajasthan. All information are in English. The founder of the museum was there and was very helpful. If you read everything the visit will take an hour. It is worth going there.

title: Superb!
review: A must visit to appreciate the dying talent of the puppeteers. Shows starts at 6:30 - 7:30 PM and 7:30 - 8:30 PM.

title: Excellent puppet show, must if you have kids !
review: The puppet show is very good about an hour long..with commentary, music, songs. they show a total of 5-6 scenes with a moral behind every scene. The show is overall fun. The seating is comfortable.

title: Puppet show
review: This is a small museum run by a single man. his work must be appreciated.contains the antique things mainly related to the city of Jaisalmer. also shows the history of the city. There is also the arrangement of puppet show for the public. very nice. kids enjoyed alot.

title: Amazing puppet show
review: I recommend it to all, this puppet show is entertaining for all age groups. Puppitier at back stage is amazing artist shem bhatt and so is imamddin, kartal folk musician, singer is old and very melodious. Nk sharma is trying to save this dying art, hats off to him

title: Worth a visit
review: I came here for the puppet show and the place gave me a lot more.

title: Cool Puppet Show and great info but the museum needs work
review: We visited the Desert Culture Centre and Museum primarily to see the puppet show as it's one of the more kid-friendly activities in Jaisalmer.

title: Puppet show
review: I must visit place if u are in jaisalmer.

title: Puppet show was good
review: It was not great, but those who have not seen the puppet show may visit this place. You will get a chance to enjoy the live and traditional folk songs. There are two shows a day, one at 6:30 pm, another at 7:30 pm. They normally cancel the second show if there is not enough crowd. Cost per seat is Rs 100. You may buy the puppets as well. This place on the main road, walkable distance to the Gadisar lake. After boating, you may plan to visit the museum. Please note that the museum is not the prime attraction, but only the puppet show.

title: Excellent show
review: Really enjoyable show, very talented puppetry and local music with singing all done by one family! The founder is very knowledgeable and enthusiastic so you can ask any questions you may have!

title: Puppet Show and Museum
review: A great effort to revive the art form and support , encourage and get patronage for the poor yet extremely talented artist. The live puppet show with live music is a treat for the eyes. I would say it is must visit if you are in Jaisalmer.

title: Museum
review: This museum is of the Founder's belonging, very enthusiastic man and he explained us the things put up for display.

title: Cultural Puppet show with pride
review: We stumbled apon this place today and thought, hey why not. It was a very surprising and special tour. We were the only ones there because it was an odd time of the day  (3 or 4pm). As we started to look around the founder of the meusum greater us and decided to  give us a private tour. Je qenr into depth aboit the  history of jaslemer while adding his own personal experience. He often peppered in  facts or stories about traditions or cultural beliefs that weren't on display.  . Very intresting indeed. It was apparent he held alot of pride in his work and enjoyed talking and teaching. The place it self is small but with the personal tour we ended up staying for 2 hours. Which was perfact time to catch the puppet show that started at 630 pm (first show). Which was included in our admission price (100 rupees). Many people attended the puppe show. And as I was leaving many more were coming for the 2nd show (730).

title: A man on a mission
review: The project here is a one man show.

title: Too much talk; less of a show
review: Agreed that the puppet show is a dying are and the founder has spent fortune in building the facility and maintaining it. But on a whole there were around 5-6 shows and most of the time was consumed by the founder, who was speaking about himself. While the show was good, there can be more importance to the show rather than the person.

title: Interesting small museum
review: Great little museum. Owner has many old things that show history of the area and the desert people. Worth the 200 rupees to see some very old and interesting things. Its down a small alleyway so you have to look for it. owner also has shop next door with clothes and such.

title: Wonderful live music and puppet show
review: A really wonderful and unique place. The live music was of incredible quality and with explanation in both English and Hindi. Its one man really trying to keep local culture alive and tell stories through an ancient medium. Well worth the money and great for all ages. The puppet performance was well more spectacular than i could have guessed. The museum is very interesting too, a real preservation of a diminishing culture and tradition. Some of these musicians tour the world and are high class performers.

title: Loved this museum, great insight into local culture
review: We went to watch the puppet show which was very entertaining, but what I enjoyed most was getting to look at the exhibits afterwards and chat to the owner Mr Sharma. He was extremely knowledgeable and enthusiastic about the history and heritage of the area.

title: the best puppet show...
review: its bang opposite Gadi sagar laeka nd runs puppet show each evening. Mr. Sharam himswelf runs it even at the age of 80,, So authentic and charming place gives first hand feeling of local culture and history... Sure to visit ..  Hats off to Mr. Sharma for keeping the tradition alive ...

title: Great little history
review: Visited this place based on recommendation from a friend. Saw the puppet show and was incredibly impressed and the museum was very well maintained. Highly recommended for a great cultural experience.

title: A Must see place in Jaisalmer
review: This museum is opposite to the Gadsisar Lake. It is operated by Prof Sharma and his team. Salute to the efforts put in and the energy of this old man in operating the cultural center. The center conducts 2 puppet shows in the evening. It was quite fun and entertaining to watch the shows. Mr Sharma himself hosts and sing in the entire 45 min show, gives information about Jaisalmer and Maru Pradesh. After the show visited the small museum around the show hall. They are making a lot of efforts to keep the puppet show art alive and I feel we all should support them in whatever way possible. (The easiest way by visiting the museum and attending the show).  They have a sovenir shop in the premises where you can buy local items at a price lower then the market outside.

title: Great jem for local history and puppet show
review: Attended the puppet show with the kids, which was truly entertaining even for adults accompanied by fabulous musicians and puppet master. The crew involved the kids in the play and presented all story introductions in English.

title: Most missed out thing in Jaisalmer
review: I always prefer for low budget tourism. There is no meaning to spend so much where it can be managed in such a less amount of money. It is in 5 mins walking distance from airforce circle.

title: Put your tourism dollars to do good and preserve local culture!
review: Must see! This small individually assembled museum was the highlight of my visit to Jaisalmer. I learned so much about traditional desert culture and it enlightened many of the people and things I saw the next day.

title: Desert Gem
review: A must see! Wonderful history and persvation of culture. The owner dedicated his life to collecting and preserving all this history -- Mr. NK Sharman's passion shines through. More importantly, entertainment! There is a nightly puppet show and it was excellent. There's also a museum within the culture center that is very informative on the local history. Doesn't take too long to see it all unless you want to delve into learning all the details of the history of Rajashtan and Jaisalmer. Fun time.

title: Puppet Show
review: The owner of this place Mr. N. K. Sharma puts up a puppet show every day which is definitely a must watch if you are near the lake. We ended up going to this place after we visited the Gadisar Lake for the 7 pm show. There are a lot more puppet shows near the lake. But we visited this one as we had heard about it on Trip Advisor itself.

title: A wonder
review: I was stunned when I saw their performances, well choreographed great music and storytelling is also very attractive. It's a tragedy that people are not interested in this place

title: Now combined with popular Folklore Museum
review: Great museum, show, and wonderful owner! Well worth your time to stop in on your way to the Gadisar Lake or for an evening show before dinner.

title: A brief overview of Rajasthani culture and puppet show
review: It's must thing to do when visiting Jaiselmer. There are two shows in the evening daily - 1 hour each. Puppet, folksongs, stories etc.

title: Interesting Culture Centre and Museum
review: This Culture centre and museum has a wide collection of traditional instruments,medieval coins and ethnic artefacts.This museum also consists of rare fossils,ancient scriptures and royal age coins.Must visit by an art and history enthusiasts.

title: String puppets
review: AmAzing show of puppets , they even allow you to see string puppets art , how they handle them . Must visit place with popcorn n front seat

title: Average Culture Show with a mildly interesting puppet show
review: Close to the fort , this one is run by the locals , the entire show lasts for about an hour and a half and has some local folklore and story telling sessions interspersed with local music and puppet shows , the latter can be bought after the show at a better price than the one prevailing at the roadside stalls. Go there if you have nothing better to do in the evening

title: amazing puppet show
review: The puppet show is a must see - amazing performance with live music and lots of informations about puppet show tradition and jaisalmer. The museum is also worth visit - although it can be tiring to read all the information there

title: One man show
review: Sharmaji is active in running this centre. Manu artisans are seen there working happily.  Beautiful puppets show and you can buy the puppets if you want.

title: Puppets show
review: Desert museum is known for the best puppet show in Jaisalmer, actively running by Sharma Ji. Allows us to see the puppets show and handle them in our hands.

title: Help save a dying art!
review: This is a small but professional operation preserving traditional Rajasthani puppetry (Kathputli). Contrary to what I heard before going, this style of puppetry is not just for children. As an adult, I found the performance UTTERLY DELIGHTFUL.

title: Puppet show!!
review: I visited this place today.  The puppet show was really amazing.

title: Must visit
review: It's an hour show resembling to bagaron ki haveli show in udaipur. But here one can see amazing puppet show which would be imperfect if there was no good singing and kartar

title: Quality, Original and Entertaining
review: I didn't plan to visit museum by while walking down the road I just thought to check it out. I was amazed by the talented artists, their energy and enthusiasm during the play. A great work by Mr N K Sharma and very humble figure whom I met also. Definitely this is a place and show which no one should miss. The effort he has put in to conserve the Rajasthani puppet culture is brilliant.

title: Entertaining puppet show
review: It was quite a entertaining show for an hour and half which gives an overview of Golden city jaisalmer and 40 mins puppet show. Very few packages or Google mentions visit to desert and cultural museum.  I would recommend each traveller to visit this place becuz it's an effort of one name N.K Sharma to keep the cultural katputli show alive . We weren't quite keen initially to visit,  but after listening to the live musical instruments and singing nd looking puppet show I felt it was worth it.

title: Decent museum and puppet show
review: This museum is set up by an individual. It is bigger and better than the Thar Desert Museum. Exhibits are interesting with English subtitles. It also host a nightly puppet show (about 30 min long). Stories are short and simple. Kids will love it more.

title: rescued
review: culture and heritage of this city is wrapped inside this museum

title: Puppet show on rajasthani folk songs
review: Must visit if you interested in something traditional and actually Indian thing.. A Puppet show.. folk music, local singer, traditional musical instrument and a single man behind everything is your host.. :-) especially for those who wants to learn rajasthan history..

title: Worth a visit for the nightly puppet shows
review: This place organises nightly Rajasthani puppet shows. If I remember correctly the admission for both the museum and the puppet show is INR 150. There are 2 sessions, 7 and 8 pm. Each lasts around an hour and includes 4-5 short segments. Mr Sharma, who set up the museum, provides a basic synopsis of each segment. After the performance you can go up close to take photos of the puppeteers. You can also purchase the puppets if you wish. Mr Sharma is very knowledgeable about Jaisalmer, its history and desert life in general. The museum has a range of dusty exhibits, which he collected himself.  The accompanying labels are not really helpful. There is also a bookshop at the back.

title: The puppet show is extremely good and a must visit
review: The Puppet show is the best I have ever seen in my life, Mr Sharma does the story naration followed by the puppet act and the folk song, I would recommend this to everyone who visit Jaisalmer, Do not miss it.

title: Dying Art
review: We had a great experience here enjoying folk art and music. Completely worth the time spent. Do visit once when you go to visit the lake.

title: Worth a visit, kids would love it.
review: It is certainly inspiring and motivating to see what a one common man can do to save an art. Hats off to Mr. N. K. Sharma.

title: Loved it and loved Mr Sharma
review: This is a wonderful museum created by the very lovely and interesting Mr Sharma who told us lots about Indian culture and personally showed us around his museum. We then saw the puppet show which was hilarious and well worth a watch. Very talented young men from the local community who were outstanding at percussion, singing and of course puppetry.

title: Amazing Puppet show
review: i saw a puppet doll show first time and it was amazing show nearly one hour. it was on song "Mast Kalander"  and more 2-3 but we enjoyed a lot that show and in end we buy a 4 puppets.

title: Nice summary of local traditions
review: The museum is the labor of one man that is trying hard to preserve the local culture. It is worth a visit. Does not take more than an hour. The puppet show is really nice.

title: Great puppet show
review: Mr Sharma is a lovely man with great knowledge of the region.

title: Tiny Museum, Old Exhibits
review: Don't go out of your way to visit this place.  The tired exhibits haven't been updated in years (decades?).  Even so, they do provide pretty decent English descriptions of many historical, geological, and cultural artifacts.  Even if you lingered at each exhibit, you might be done with the visit in 45 minutes.  That said, the material isn't that interesting, even if you are a fan of different cultures like I am.

title: Laudable result of indefatigable efforts of a 80 year old teacher.
review: Single handed effort of Mr Nand Kishore Sharma, depicting the History, Culture, craft, music and art of Jaisalmer.

title: Nice small museum
review: The best part of this was the puppet show. Our kids enjoyed it. They have done well to keep the talent and the show going.

title: So much to learn, so much to see!
review: I went to the museum last night to see the puppet show. They have one every night at 6:30pm. It was only 100rupees and I got there early, so I was able to look around the museum before the show. The museum itself is small, but packed with tons of information! It definetly gives a lot of information about Jaisalmer, Rajasthan and India. Allow yourself at least 30 minutes, if not more, to get through all the information. There are also tons of artifacts! If the owner is around (which he usually is), he is happy to show you around and explain things to you. He is a great guy who is passionate about preserving culture and sharing it with everyone!

title: Puppet show
review: Puppet show is worth seeing! Great live music and typical Rajasthani puppets. Our one year old son loved it.

title: Puppet show
review: Hello this is a great place to know more about the culture of desert People and traditions.  It was founded  by a single man. No many  People Go there and Its no well known  in many of the advertisement.

title: Something for your eyes and your heart!
review: Small but interesting museum and the puppet show is very cute! Mr. Sharma, the founder, is a very friendly man and knows quite everything about Rajasthan culture. I liked this place very much! Your visit can help to preserve this kind of art in mordern times.

title: Awesome show and performances
review: It's a must visit place,  which is the effort of just one person M.r N.K.SHARMA.  had a chance to personally talk with him while leaving the place.  A very humble man with alot of knowledge. And is trying is best to save the culture and heritage, and have contributed all his life,  learning and earing in to this place.

title: Effort of the passion of a Single man - needs a lot of patronage support
review: They run 2 shows daily (6 to 7 pm and 7 pm to 8 pm), If they dont have enough people for the second show then both shows could be merged. This center is the creation of a single person - a frail old but incredibly passionate man Mr. M.K Sharma. In my view the center is doing good work in patronizing the local artistes but more needs to be done. A little bit of commercialization will be helpful in benefiting the center and the artistes. One can buy puppets here for kids and that is recommended for supporting the center and artistes.

title: Must visit excellent show
review: It is well managed by Mr N K Sharma a retired school teacher. The moto of this center to regain the lost glory of poor artists.

title: Great place and lovely insight into Rajasthani culture
review: This museum and the Kathputhli dance show accompanied by Mr. N.K. Sharma's narration is a lovely experience.

title: Good place to spend some time
review: This centre offers daily two puppet shows @ 6.30 pm & 7.30 pm. The show last for abt 40 mnts. They charge Rs 100 person & Rs 50 for camera.

title: Definitely Worth A Visit
review: Mr Sharma, a retired teacher from Jaisalmer, now "80 years young" has collected  every exhibit in this museum over many generations. He was very friendly and talked us around some of his pieces.  As non Indians he explained to us about turbans and how the women wear different coloured sari if they are  married, unmarried or a widow.  He has written several books.  I bought Way of Life in Desert.  Which for a 150 rupee has loads of fascinating facts and history about Jaisalmer. It was a pleasure to meet such an interesting man.

title: What a lovely treasure trove
review: I went to the museum to see the puppet show and met Mr Sharma who established and runs the place. It was the highlight of my day having a conversation with Mr Sharma who used to be a history teacher and gave me more insight into India. This museum is Mr Sharma's collection from all over Rajasthan and I highly recommend you to visit it, check out the puppet show and if you have a chance, speak to Mr Sharma himself. What a lovely person, it was my absolute pleasure to visit the museum and chat with you. Hope to see you again soon!

title: Excellent Place
review: Where ever i went the people were very helpful and kind and this is one of the thing i remember while life and one of the local suggested us to visit the place and we find the place s amazing. We watched puppet show and other art forms of rajasthan. Recommended place to visit.

title: A PLACE FOR CHILDREN
review: visited the cultural center and museum on 01.01.2016. the puppet show was excellent to watch specially for for our daughter.

title: Nice Museum with puppet show for kids.
review: Unfortunately not many people visit this place , but this is indeed an informative place where many traces of history are kept regarding Jaisalmer kingdom. A puppet show is also there in the evening 6.30 and 7.30 where you can see this soon to be extinct art.

title: Most Authentic Puppet Show!
review: I got chance to visit Puppet shows at different locations, but this is the most authentic one with fine perfection which other places is missing. If you are interested in Puppet show, this is the must.. There are two shows one with English explanation at 6:30pm and the other at 7:30pm in Hindi.

title: Interesting museum and puppet show also
review: A small, interesting museum with many intriguing objects.. The museum also hosts a puppet show every night. The puppet show (less than an hour) was fascinating e.g. one puppet was a man one way up and a woman another way up was a woman and another puppet was a man riding a camel and whipping it when it sank to its knees.

title: excellent puppet show
review: You can visit this place to enjoy the puppet show. They do sell puppets at the end of the show. an old teacher by profession takes care of this place and wants all tourist to know the real jaisalmer

title: Nice place to visit
review: The place is one man initiative who is trying to keep the Jaisalmer culture alive. The programme they does is good and person enjoy the dance and the songs sang by the artists. The programme is in evening 6.30 t0 7.30 and 7.30 to 8.30.

title: Need to be supported
review: This centre is working to preserve the dying art form of traditional puppetry and as such needs to be supported. The program is average though.

title: Give it a miss if you have been to Bagore Ki Haveli's Darohar show
review: A commendable effort by a single man Mr. NK Sharma to showcase the history of Jaisalmer !!

title: About desert culture
review: Culture is really enjoyable in desert under the sky in winter season. People will get coffee with pakora (frying potato). This is very nice.

title: Charming museum and traditional puppet show.
review: Mr Sharma built this museum to preserve the traditions of the local people. It was such a pleasure to meet him and get a personal tour of his collections, we were very touched by the attention he gave to us and his enthusiasm. We returned in the evening to watch the puppet show. Live music and costumes, with colourful and entertaining puppetry.

title: great cultural and societal perspective
review: it shows the subtleties of the ancient rajasthani culture. the museum is fabulous; makes you forget everything in the mirage of the desert culture. the tourists must go there and spend an hour to understand everything kept there for display.

title: Puppet Show in Jaisalmer
review: its a 40 minute puppet show. The quality of the show is incredible. With just 2 shows in a day its worth watching and buying a few puppets.

title: Must see
review: Try and make it for the 6:30 or 7:30 show and in early.usually its packed.try and learn a bit of Hindi.the locals were laughing and clapping all the time.I guess its nice then

title: The Puppet show is mediocre.
review: Unless you have children who can enjoy a puppet show, this privately run place nothing really to offer. The puppet show is only for about 15/20 minutes duration.

title: Great effort by Shree Sharma
review: Must see the puppet show....the villagers charisma.....puppets dancing in fingures and villagers folk songs......Salute to Shree sharma ji effort to keep it live.

title: Grand Effort of a Local Teacher
review: Although nothing grand about the place, the effort of a local teacher in collecting various historical facts and presenting these at one place is certainly praise worthy. The Kathputli show is also good. Worth a visit.

title: An Effort to Save the art of puppeteer !
review: In this ever changing fast pace world we have lost many traditions and types of art. One of the art which is at brink of extinction is that of puppeteer, which requires very good skills and imagination to make puppets behave so naturally in the shows. It was good to see people trying to save this art and the show was good too.

title: Puppets!
review: Looking for something to do in the evening we fojnd ourselves at the museum and puppet show. The museum was small and a little tough to follow but the puppet show was very entertaining and informative.  Maybe about 15 min too long, but I enjoyed it all the same.

title: Good way of spending an afternoon.
review: Nuce papet shie and a gud place to find out about local and gipsy culture. Fotos videos and exchibition  help fore the gud understanding of cast sistam

title: Better ever puppet showin local talent
review: They have two puppet shows at 6:30 pm and 7:30pm.... It depicts true talent of local tradition and a must visit place in Jaisalmer......

title: Something to do one evening
review: The puppets are only on strings rahter than yokes, which means the actions that can be performed with them is quite limited compared to other puppet shows I have seen, but entertaining none the less. Think punch & judy gone weird performed exclusively with a kazoo. You'll understand what i mean after seeing it.

title: An effort worth applauding
review: started by a former teacher, Mr.N.K Sharma, this is a place to experience true Rajasthani art forms. On the face of it, the museum is nothing unusual ( a little shabby) but you must wait for the music program to start and then you will be enthralled.

title: Give it a pass
review: We visited the Lok Kala Mandal in Udaipur and this was our last stop during our trip to Rajasthan. Having some time to spare, we headed to this museum with high expectations. We were disappointed. Compared to Lok Kala Mandal in Udaipur, this place fares very badly. The local artisans make a decent effort at puppetry but are no match for their cousins in Udaipur. The museum, per say, is okay. Ticket prices are Rs. 50 a head (about USD 1), higner than Lok Kala Mandam (Rs. 30) and not worth the price. Yet if you want to support the local artisans and have real time to spare, go for it.

title: Lovely!
review: Mr. Sharma received us with warmth and hospitality. The puppet theater and music were most enjoyable, as was the cultural collection on display. Do visit if you are in Jaisalmer!

title: Interesting
review: A visit to this museum was kind of a glance at a festival of vintage, full of curios. Well worth a peek around to get to know the local

title: Brings out the child in all of us !
review: I'm not a museum person but this one had some interesting bits. However, the highlight was the puppet show. If you want all high tech and glitz then this is not the place to go but if you want traditional, home style entertainment, with passion then this is lots of fun. The founder is a lovely old man who just wants to retain his local heritage; an objective that should be applauded, and supported.

title: Fabulous. Simple but Fabulous
review: I have seen one other rather dodgy rajasthani puppet show in New Delhi, so I wasn't holding my breath. I was super pleasantly surprised after a walk around a museum with some random bits and pieces, and watching a tourist video about Rajasthan, the musicians and puppeteers completely won me over.

title: amazing visit
review: it is a life time experience...must see this...do not overlook...so many things are here for which you might have not even heard,,,question of seeing is far away...

title: Easy to miss as it's not very popular - BUT a MUST VISIT
review: On our visit to Gadisar lake, we were handed out a leaflet about a puppet show at this museum and since it seemed interesting, we turned up at the venue at 7:30 PM.

title: Good Rajasthani cultural experience
review: This was recommended by our driver in Jaisalmer and as my daughter was interested in puppet show, went to the show in evening. The show is for 1 hour and it has 20 mins of recommended documentary about Rajasthan and around 40 mins of puppet show followed by walk through of museum collection and books and CD for purchase.

title: Must Visit
review: Mr. N.K. Sharma doing a great job by preserving Puppetry art and keeping this museum alive. We felt really thankful to this man for his dedication.

title: Very nice
review: it is quite interesting. real good effort to keep the old spirit alive. Met the owner Mr. N.K.sharma..a real good knowledgeable man with lots of stuff with him back from history.

title: Good place
review: The puppet show was excellent and for me it was the first time i was seeing our age old puppet show. My family liked the complete 1 hr show.

title: Never miss the puppet show
review: The old man is trying his best to save this culture and the puppet show was excellent. Any one who visits Jaisalmer should visit this place to encourage the traditional culture of Rajasthan.

title: lively puppet show
review: This is a short tuk tuk ride from the fort area. We went to the puppet show which ran for around 45 minutes and consisted of a series of sketches with dancing puppets accompanied by a couple of musicians, each introduced in Hindi and English. The show was lively and good fun. Around the hall where the show takes place there are corridors with glass cases containing a wide variety of objects collected by the owner, including lots of musical instruments, portable temples and pictures. We looked round these before and after the show and learnt quite a lot.

title: Must visit
review: If you want to know the rajasthani people and their culture, this place is a must visit. DO NOT MISS the puppet show in the evening. If you buy a ticket for the puppet show, they let you see around the museum for free. This is a non profit initiative by a retired person named Mr. N.k. Sharma.

title: Lovely little museum and puppet show.
review: Really interesting museum full of traditional artefacts from remote areas of Rajasthan, collected by one man, who has made it his life's work, and is happy to talk to you about it. Also a puppet show each evening, which was great fun.

title: Museum and Puppet Show
review: Good effort to save tradition of India by Mr. N.K Sharma .Good Puppet show in the evening, a must watch show.

title: work of one man army
review: This is made by single handle by Mr. Sharma to bring this to world.. a really appreciable effort of this legend... god blesh mr sharma long year..

title: 10th and 12th century things
review: The main attraction of this museum is wood fossils obtained from village Akal which is 17 Km from Jaisalmer, are believed to be 180 million years old. The formation of rocks in Jaisalmer, chiefly lime stone are of Jurassic period. There is also a display of few tools of Early & Middle Stone Age (10,000 to 7,000 B.C.). We also saw Tamar Patra (copper plates with writings) of 12th century.  There is a display of a few sculptures and stone carvings dated from 10th and 12th century.

title: Folk art
review: This is a private museum showcasing the history of Jaisalmer and various artefacts. A puppet show by the local artisans is conducted in the evening, however the show is not upto the mark as that of Bharatiya Lok  Kala Mandal In Udaipur, still the attempt is appreciative.

title: Nice place to spend your evening...
review: Puppet shows are held daily at 6:30 PM and 7:30 PM

title: Don't Miss This Gem
review: We came across this by chance. It is a private collection of folk artefacts and it really is unique. It is a shame that the city fathers don't take so much care over the local heritage. INR 100 well spent.

title: Worth an hour
review: Its located exactly opposite the lake and opens only in evening for puppet show and sale of merchandise. Mr. Sharma, the person who has build it as "single man's effort", does the story telling alongside puppet show. This story telling around the history of Jaisalmer makes the experience interesting and engaging. Otherwise, puppet show isnt the best of the lot. Merchandise is available at decent price. Overall verdict: If someone finds one-person story telling of history engaging, this is nice place to visit.

title: excellent effort by Mr Sharma
review: More than the museum itself (which is noteworthy because it has been put together by a retired teacher, Mr Sharma) it is the puppet show which is the attraction. Extremely engaging and performed by a very talented lot.

title: One man's effort to keep the Rajasthani Culture alive!
review: This places gives you a glimpse of Rajasthan’s culture, which includes puppet show, folk music, a short documentary of places and history of Rajasthan, collection of musical instruments etc., thanks to the effort of a single man, Mr. N. K. Sharma. He will himself take you through the whole program. Meeting and talking to such a man is a unique experience in itself. Do not miss this place in Jaisalmer.

title: Interesting collection
review: This was our first stop. It was quite an interesting collection of city's old photographs, coins, fossils, some historical facts. Its quite commendable for one person Mr. Sharma to have organized these artefacts as a museum. He also has books and CDs for sale on the Jaisalmer's history. Puppet shows are held in the evening (2 shows), which we were unable to see, as the shows were fully booked. The museum is worth a visit.

title: Interesting little museum
review: While I was visiting Gadi Sagar Tank I stumbled upon this place. The entrance fee was just 5 rupees, and I was personally shown around the handful of rooms by the son of the man who founded it. He was very friendly and informative, and brought the exhibits to life for me. It's a small place but packed full of things. And just by the entrance, you can walk round to get a beautiful view of the fort as a whole, with the city and a pretty old graveyard in the foreground. They also do a nightly puppet show, which I ended up having to miss due to lack of time, but I was told it was worth going to.

title: Very nice effort keeping the heritage art form alive
review: Very nice museum and puppet show.  All a one man show.  Brilliant effort to keep old art and skills alive

title: Great puppet show!
review: 100 rupees per person well spent. The owner of the museum showed us around and was very informative about the artefacts he has collected over the years. The puppet show was very entertaining. A great chance to support a local business and have a great night out.

title: Loved this quirky place. Incredible artifacts and amazing music show!
review: At the tail end of our visit to Jaisalmer we more or less stumbled into this museum.  So glad we did!  The owner himself gave us a tour around the place and then the show began.  The musicians played only drums and a castanet-type instrument and it was INCREDIBLE.  The singers were awesome. The puppet show was also terrific and FAR BETTER than the show we'd seen in Udaipur.

title: Badly Maintained
review: Needs to be properly maintained. Has a lot of artefacts which has be highlighted to the visitors. Lot of knowledge can be gained from the museum pieces. Close to Hotel Moomal of the RTDC.

title: Puppet show was nice.
review: This museum organises a puppet show every evening, which is worth a watch. The puppeteers also let us try out the puppets and they also sell puppets which are priced decentl.

title: Some OK exhibits
review: A third small museum in Jaisalmer, not so big as the others but some interesting items nonetheless. I believe they do put on traditional shows here but there was nothing on over the period I visited. A 20 minute visit.

title: A Little Gem - must visit!
review: This is a very small museum located in the centre of Jaisalmer.  It is extremely interesting and informative with a number of authentic artifacts relating to the culture, history and heritage of Jaisalmer.  We were personally met by Mr Sharma who founded and runs the museum.  he was a pleasure to meet and a very interesting character.  He has personally collected and bought all the artefacts displayed over the years and is so dedicated to the conservation and preservation of the heritage and culture in this part of Rajasthan.

title: Incredible artifacts and amazing music show!
review: Its made and maintained by NK sharma,he is truly a legend. He has written over 40 books and is the foremost authority on Rajasthani culture heritage and history. The artifacts collected are mind blowing. Some of the best ever.

title: love desert
review: desert safari in jeep was awesome and thrilling

title: I paid for foto, but not found any interesting
review: Price 100 rupees, foto 50 rupees. All in a state of neglect. Exponats not interesting. Puppet show too.

title: good experience!!!
review: A very good experience and able to know the life style of the people living in this part, their colorful dress, tasty food and fold music.

title: Awsome
review: It was the best experience of our lives. My 4 years old son liked the puppet show very much. The museam gives us a glimpse of the hard life in deserts. Person running it, Mr. N.K. Sharma is doing this without any help from the government. Hats off to him.

title: Puppet show describes the Culture, History & Folk Tales
review: Loacted opposite Gadsisar Lake. The evening half an hour puppet show (2 shows after 7pm) is worth watching. We were in 1st show narrated in Hindi. Well describing Culture, History & Folk Tales by different 5 minutes puppets & musical episodes. Desert cultural center and museum is a place where you will get to know about the rich cultural heritage and customs of Jaisalmer, a popular destination in Rajasthan. So if you are short on time and cannot mug up in library, this is the place to be. The place is well maintained and harbors rare coins and manuscript related to Jaisalmer history and the history of Rajasthan in whole. This museum has some eye-catching collection of traditional Rajasthani textiles, utensils, weapons, musical instruments and fossils. One thing that is very popular among foreigners is 'Karal', the traditional opium mixing box. Started by Mr Sharma & now taken care by his son is must visit. You can buy books, CDs, DVDs, Calenders, Gifts, Note pads, maps souvenirs ets.

title: Quite Frankly Boring
review: I'm usually one for museums, history, and reading but quite frankly I found the place boring. The presentation was like that of a school project. The history and text given was long and dull and it was hard to keep interested. It seemed like the place was packed with the instruments to beef it up, I know they are significant local instruments but to me they didn't add anything to the place. Entry is R50 which is reasonable if you get something out of it, on the flip side you may be fighting to stay after 10 minutes. If you read everything in the place you'll be done in under an hour.

title: Nice place opposite Gadisar lake
review: Desert Culture centre and musuem is the place where one retired school teacher Mr Sharma has collected various items and runs a small museum and displays cultural & puppet show. Opposite the lake, this place cannot be missed . There is a puppet show 6.30 and 7.30 pm at this place. One can plan a visit after visiting the Gadisar lake. It is a very nice place to get a view of the puppets closely and enjoy the Rajasthani folk songs. They start with small DVD of Rajasthan in case one is going there for the first time will be useful tourist information. There are various items as gifts and souvenirs available on sale here for the tourists who want to gift something after the puppet show. Sincere thanks to Mr Sharma and one should appreciate the efforts to put this up. Nothing great as museum but worth it for the puppet show.

title: A stellar puppet show
review: I don't know about the museum, but the puppet show every evening is an enchanting experience. It is a string puppet show accompanied with Rajasthani folk song, typically performed by village folks coming from poor backgrounds. Mr. NK Sharma, a retired teacher runs this show, and any collection from this goes towards development of this unique art and supporting the artists. This is a place not to miss in Jaisalmer.

title: A rare experience
review: Mr NK Sharma at a ripe old age is doing a stellar job of preserving crafts and art traditions in a detailed and well-researched manner.Entirely his own initiative, he deserves every support from independent travellers, as he is not paying cuts and commissions to tour operators to give him publicity.I learned more at the museum than I did in the commercially run and cut-throat ventures operating elsewhere in Jaisalmer city as supposed defenders of local arts and crafts.

title: Excellent entertaining string puppet show
review: We enjoyed an excellent entertaining string puppet show at this amazing place near Ghadisar lake in Jaisalmer. Performed by local artists, this show combines the traditional skills of string puppetry with folk music, songs and old musical instruments of Marwad and Rajasthan.

title: Great Show
review: Very entertaining show-the musicians were wonderful and full of energy. The show lasted for about 40 minutes and costs 50 INR/person +50INR if you want to take pictures. We were the only ones there for the show since it is off season but they made us feel very welcome. We walked around the museum beforehand and found all of the owners personal collections quite fascinating. He is such a lovely man who wants to teach and show tourists what life was like-definitely worth a trip during your stay in Jaisalmer!

title: The Puppet Show is very good!
review: We didn't see the documentary. But the Puppet Show was simply great! Very different from so many other puppet shows that you see in every city across the country.Beautifully done and dressed puppets. The musicians and support players were excellent. Since there isn't much to do in Jaislamer, this certainly has to be on your itinerary.

title: Must visit...must must must
review: Its made and maintained by NK sharma,he is truly a legend. He has written over 40 books and is the foremost authority on Rajasthani culture heritage and history. The artifacts collected are mind blowing. Some of the best ever. I have visited many many museums, this one is gonna stay with me forever. Visit this place for the man. He was 90 and still walked the whole way with us. Truly excited to show us the place. I loved the illustrated story tellers. We bought two folk music CDs which truly are aweeesssommmeeee. You must must visit this place.

title: Dessert culture show
review: Nice place to visit. Great work by artists preserving Rajasthan culture and diminishing string puppet art.

title: Do visit
review: It is all an effort of an octogenarian who we met at the entrance.. His collections done carefully over the years. Brief history of the place n displayed items. The puppet show by the talented puppeteers was nice. U can also buy puppets n other collectibles from the shop

title: Amazing experience
review: The puppet show was beautiful. Within an hour you get to see 5-6 brilliant performances. The background story/insight was beautifully narrated and rendered, transporting us back in time. It was a wonderful wonderful experience and should not be missed by anyone travelling to Jaisalmer. Ticket was only RS. 100

title: Fantastic Museum & Puppet Show - A Must Visit
review: This is a Museum and puppet show with a lot of heart built into it. Mr. N.K. Sharma has done a magnificent job on his own in creating this museum for all of us to visit and enjoy in Jaisalmer.

title: Mr Sharma you rock
review: Mr Sharma is a real gem, built the museum with his retirement money and hard work. There is lots of information here and some beautiful old musical instruments. There is a puppet show in the evening. Keeping an ancient culture alive. Do visit.

title: Good for children
review: It's a good experience for young children otherwise ok. Although, this support the people and culture so worth considering that.

title: Family visit
review: This place is close to gadi sagar lake hence one can spend few minutes here. Otherwise it is not interesting place

title: Small but nice place to see
review: Visit this after 6 PM only,

title: Information holds all the essence
review: College tour at this place, it is very informative, regarding the culture of Rajasthan and what holds the essence is museum objects which are sacred and the owner, not only looks after the museum but also finds interest in sharing the stories. Believe me, i recommend not to believe any other person than him regarding true stories of objects and everything he has got knowledge about. Fabulous location because there is a lake view near this museum. Do visit the puppet show.

title: Excellent entertaining string puppet show
review: We enjoyed an excellent entertaining string puppet show at this amazing place near Ghadisar lake in Jaisalmer. Performed by local artists, this show combines the traditional skills of string puppetry with folk music, songs and old musical instruments of Marwad and Rajasthan.

title: Dessert culture show
review: Nice place to visit. Great work by artists preserving Rajasthan culture and diminishing string puppet art.

title: Amazing experience
review: The puppet show was beautiful. Within an hour you get to see 5-6 brilliant performances. The background story/insight was beautifully narrated and rendered, transporting us back in time. It was a wonderful wonderful experience and should not be missed by anyone travelling to Jaisalmer. Ticket was only RS. 100

title: Fantastic Museum & Puppet Show - A Must Visit
review: This is a Museum and puppet show with a lot of heart built into it. Mr. N.K. Sharma has done a magnificent job on his own in creating this museum for all of us to visit and enjoy in Jaisalmer.

title: Do visit
review: It is all an effort of an octogenarian who we met at the entrance.. His collections done carefully over the years. Brief history of the place n displayed items. The puppet show by the talented puppeteers was nice. U can also buy puppets n other collectibles from the shop

title: Good for children
review: It's a good experience for young children otherwise ok. Although, this support the people and culture so worth considering that.

title: Mr Sharma you rock
review: Mr Sharma is a real gem, built the museum with his retirement money and hard work. There is lots of information here and some beautiful old musical instruments. There is a puppet show in the evening. Keeping an ancient culture alive. Do visit.

title: Family visit
review: This place is close to gadi sagar lake hence one can spend few minutes here. Otherwise it is not interesting place

title: Information holds all the essence
review: College tour at this place, it is very informative, regarding the culture of Rajasthan and what holds the essence is museum objects which are sacred and the owner, not only looks after the museum but also finds interest in sharing the stories. Believe me, i recommend not to believe any other person than him regarding true stories of objects and everything he has got knowledge about. Fabulous location because there is a lake view near this museum. Do visit the puppet show.

title: Small but nice place to see
review: Visit this after 6 PM only,
